intro: Argostemma distichum, commonly known as the two-ranked argostemma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, linear leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
